translator_notes: '杨妃' (Yang Guifei) in Chapter 27 refers to Baochai, comparing her to the famous Tang dynasty beauty; '飞燕' (Zhao Feiyan) refers to Daiyu, comparing her to the Han dynasty beauty
'母蝗虫' (Mother Locust) in Chapter 41 is Miaoyu's dismissive nickname for Granny Liu
'金兰' (golden orchid) in Chapter 45 is a classical term for sworn sisterhood between women
'鸳鸯' (mandarin ducks) in Chapter 46 plays on the maid's name and the symbol of conjugal love
'呆霸王' (Stupid Tyrant) is Xue Pan's nickname; '冷郎君' (Cold Young Lord) refers to Liu Xianglian
research_notes: Chapters 21-47 cover the development of relationships within Grand View Garden and major plot events
The poetry club chapters (37-38) feature some of the novel's most celebrated verses
